avalancheActivity.comment: Isolated avalanches can be triggered in extremely steep terrain. Most releases are small. Risks of falls and injuries outweigh those of being buried in snow masses. Isolated small-sized glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Not much snow. Low avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: In some places traces of fresh fallen snow blanket a superficially melt-freeze encrusted, mostly hardened old snowpack surface, which softens up slightly during the daytime hours, particularly on sunny slopes. South-facing slopes are bare of snow up to high altitudes. Only limited information from outlying terrain is currently available to the Avalanche Warning Services.

tendency.highlights: No significant change anticipated. Low avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.comment: Extremely sunny winter sporting weather on Boxing Day with palpable easterly winds. Skies will be cloudless over far-reaching regions, it will not be very cold. Temperatures at 2000: -1 to +3 degrees; at 3000m: -5 degrees. Moderate easterly-to-southeasterly winds at high altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: In very isolated cases avalanches can be triggered in persistent weak layers on very steep shady slopes in high alpine regions. These releases are mostly small-sized. The risks of falling and sustaining injuries outweigh those of being buried in snow masses. At very high altitudes over minor areas, freshly generated but small-sized snowdrift accumulations require attentiveness.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated avalanche prone locations in persistent weak layer of old snow.

snowpackStructure.comment: In some places traces of fresh fallen snow blanket a superficially melt-freeze encrusted, mostly hardened old snowpack surface, which softens up slightly during the daytime hours, particularly on sunny slopes. South-facing slopes are bare of snow up to high altitudes. Only limited information from outlying terrain is currently available to the Avalanche Warning Services.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger expected to remain low

weatherForecast.comment: Extremely sunny winter sporting weather on Boxing Day with palpable easterly winds. Skies will be cloudless over far-reaching regions, it will not be very cold. Temperatures at 2000: -1 to +3 degrees; at 3000m: -5 degrees. Moderate easterly-to-southeasterly winds at high altitudes.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Low avalanche danger. Caution urged on very steep shady slopes in high alpine regions.
